title: Hey so uh riot... about those VUs
body:
Are we still getting them?

I mean sure, VGUs are fine, but what about all the smaller scope visual upgrades you guys used to do?

{{champion:24}} still looks like a eggplant
{{champion:77}} is utter trash unless you get the SGU skin
{{champion:25}}'s dress is made out of sheet metal
{{champion:31}} looks nothing like his splash
{{champion:34}} looks like she's made out of granite

None of these champions need dramatic gameplay changes, so why not just give them (and others) the visual touch ups that they need?

replies.body:
The reason is simple; priorities.

"If we could spend time doing just a VU for X champion, wouldn't that time be better spent giving equally outdated but more unhealthy Y champion a visual update _and_ a gameplay update?"

Riot's Champion Update team is involved with both art and gameplay, so they're gonna focus their time and attention on what they can make the most of with the time and resources they've got available to them.

This basically.

At this point we have enough designers on the Champion Update team that we can do VGU's and roughly the same pace as we were doing VU's before. It makes more sense to solve 2 problems at once rather then 1. 

The player response for a VGU is also miles ahead of the player response for VU's, which is why we decided to foucs on the VGU's for now.
So ugly champs with perfectly fine kits are just screwed?  Ryze isn't ugly at all and he's getting yet another rework...

I wouldn't say ugly champs with perfectly fine kits are screwed. There just not as high of a priority at this moment as ugly champs with unhealthy/bland kits. I also personally wouldn't say Ryze isn't ugly. 

I still think Jax could benefit from a GP level update one day. Cho is on the list to get a full VGU one day. I could also see a world in where Kayle gets a GP level VGU and Morgana gets a VU to go with it since it would be probably impossible to update one without the other.

Some of the champions that are ugly now but have good kits might have kits that feel more dated in a couple years, so they might eventually make it onto the VGU list (Udyr for example.) 

So I for sure wouldn't say ugly champs are screwed.

I'm just waiting for you guys to finish what you started with Karma, still no shield or haste animations and no sign of her twin dragons. Not to mention her kit being stale, bland and almost buff proof...

Where does Fiddlesticks fall into? Will he receive the GP level update or a full relaunch? One Rioter mentioned that they might do a Visual Update on him.

Updating Udyr and his multiple in-battle forms and multiple skins is enough work for two or three champions. If they ever do redo him, they'd probably end up doing it like Sona where they have one base model that surrounds itself with different particles as he changes stances.
That is the problem with champions with Ultimate skins. Not to say we would never update them just that it would take as much time as doing 2-3 other updates.
